translation: The arrows were discharged and the warriors were wounded.
The shields were slipping down and the fires blzed.533.

gurmukhi: KRxxx KolM ] bRxxx bolM ] kRxxx rosM ] jRxxx josM ]534]
transliteration: Khran-nan Dholan|| Bran-nan Bolan|| Kran-nan Rosan|| Jran-nan Josan||534||
translation: The helmets were knocked and the wounds were caused, the warriors were infuriated and their zeal grew.534.

gurmukhi: bRxxx bwjI ] qiRxxx qwjI ] jRxxx jUJy ] lRxxx lUJy ]535]
transliteration: Bran-nan Baajee|| Trin-nan Taajee|| Jran-nan Joojhe|| Lran-nan Loojhe||535||
translation: The fast-moving horses began to run and the warriors obtained salvation after severe fighting.535.

gurmukhi: hrxx hwQI ] srxx swQI ] Brxx Bwjy ] lrxx lwjy ]536]
transliteration: Harnan Haathee|| Sarnan Saathee|| Bharnan Bhaaje|| Larnan Laaje||536||
translation: The elephants ran like deer and the warriors took refuge with their comrades; the enemies ran and felt shy of fighting.536.

gurmukhi: crxx crmM ] brxx brmM ] krxx kwty ] brxx bwty ]537]
transliteration: Charnan Charman|| Barnan Barman|| Kranan Kaate|| Barnan Baate||537||
translation: The bodies and the armours were cut, the ears and eyes were amputated.537.

gurmukhi: mrxx mwry ] qrxx qwry ] jrxx jIqw ] srxx sIqw ]538]
transliteration: Marnan Mdare|| Tarnan Tdare|| Jarnan Jeetaa|| Sarnan Seetaa||538||
translation: The warriors breathed their last and ferried across the world-ocean, some were burnt in the fire of ire and took rufuge.538.

gurmukhi: grxx gYxM ] Arxx AYxM ] hrxx hUrM ] prxx pUrM ]539]
transliteration: Gadnan Gadnan|| Arnan Ainan|| Harnan Hooran|| Parnan Pooran||539||
translation: The gods moved in their air-vehicles and saw the scene; the heavenly damsels wandered and began to wed the warriors.539.

gurmukhi: brxx bwjy ] grxx gwjy ] srxx su`Jy ] jrxx ju`Jy ]540]
transliteration: Barnan Baaje|| Gadnan Gadje|| Sarnan Sujjhe|| Jarnan Jujjhe||540||
translation: Various types of musical instruments resounded and the elephants thundered; the warriors took refuge while some began to fight.,540.

gurmukhi: q`q qIrM ] b`b bIrM ] F`l FwlM ] j`j juAwlM ]541]
transliteration: Tatt Taaran|| Babh Bderan|| Dhall Dhaalan|| Jajj Juaalan||541||
translation: The arrows began to kill warriors and the fire came out of the shelds.541.

gurmukhi: q`j qwjI ] g`g gwjI ] m`m mwry ] q`q qwry ]542]
transliteration: Tajj Taajee|| Gadg Gadjee|| Mamm Mdare|| Tatt Tdare||542||
translation: The horses began to run and the warriors began to roar; they began to kill one another and ferry across the worls-ocean.542.

gurmukhi: j`j jIqy ] l`l lIqy ] q`q qory ] C`C Cory ]543]
transliteration: Jajj Jeete|| Lall Leete|| Tatt Tore|| Chhachchh Chore||543||
translation: After gaining victory in war, the enemies were being made allies, the cleavage was caused amongst the warriors and they were also being forsaken.543.

gurmukhi: r`r rwjM ] g`g gwjM ] D`D DwXM ] c`c cwXM ]544]
transliteration: Rarr Raajan|| Gadg Gadjan|| Dhaddh Dhaayan|| Chachch Chaayan||544||
translation: The king Ravana thundered violently and with great zeal marched forward.544.
